[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Integration: DKG security] If this PCS is used for Aptos DKG, can Byzantine validators exploit PCS vulnerabilities to bias randomness beacon outputs and manipulate validator selection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Integration: Consensus impact] Can proof forgery in this PCS enable attackers to create invalid DKG transcripts that validators accept, breaking consensus safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Integration: Validator participation] Can slow verify() operations (computational DoS) prevent validators from timely DKG participation, causing liveness failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Integration: State consistency] If different validators use different PCS implementations, can commitment/proof incompatibility cause state divergence requiring hard forks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Integration: Upgrade safety] If PCS implementation is upgraded mid-DKG, can old proofs become invalid, causing DKG ceremony failures and validator set lockup? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Rust: Lifetime issues] Do trait methods properly handle lifetimes for borrowed CommitmentKey/VerificationKey, or can dangling references cause use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Rust: Trait object safety] Is PolynomialCommitmentScheme trait object safe for dynamic dispatch, or does it require generic implementations only? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Rust: Send/Sync bounds] Are CommitmentKey and Proof Send+Sync for multi-threaded DKG, or can missing bounds cause concurrency issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Rust: Overflow checks] In random_poly() line 89, does bit shift right properly handle overflow, or can debug vs release builds behave differently causing test/production inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Edge case: Maximum degree] Can an attacker commit to polynomials at maximum supported degree to trigger edge cases in evaluation or verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Edge case: Constant polynomials] Do constant polynomials (degree 0) commit/open/verify correctly, or do they cause degenerate behavior enabling attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Edge case: Single-variable polynomials] Can single-variable polynomials (num_vars=1) be exploited differently than multivariate ones to forge proofs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Edge case: Field characteristic] Does the trait work correctly for small characteristic fields, or can small-field attacks enable proof forgery? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Edge case: Multiple degree bounds] In setup() line 21, can an attacker provide conflicting degree bounds causing key generation to fail or produce weak keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Adaptive chosen-message] Can an attacker adaptively choose polynomials and challenges to extract information about CommitmentKey structure enabling forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Proof substitution] Can an attacker substitute a proof from one commitment/challenge into verification for different commitment/challenge and have it accepted? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Commitment malleability] Can an attacker transform a valid commitment into a different commitment that still corresponds to the same polynomial, enabling equivocation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Batch splitting] Can an attacker split batch_open() calls to verify proofs individually and accept some while rejecting others, breaking atomicity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Transcript poisoning] Can an attacker pre-commit values to transcript before open/verify that bias challenge generation toward values enabling forgery? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Key substitution] Can an attacker use a VerificationKey from different setup in verify() to accept invalid proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Attack: Degree inflation] Can an attacker pad polynomials with high-degree zero terms to bypass degree checks while maintaining commitment consistency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Side-channel: Commitment timing] Does commit() execution time vary based on polynomial coefficients, leaking information about secret values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pcs/traits.rs] [Side-channel: Verification timing] Does verify() timing reveal whether proofs are valid before returning, enabling timing-based proof testing? (Medium)
